page.title: 04LANDSCAPE
page.content: The coastline at Tunstall has changed dramatically since Roman times.In those days Tunstall was two and a half miles from the sea.Today it is considered to be a seaside village with tourist facilities on the cliff top.The village,itself,is only a quarter of a mile from the coast.The cliffs are being eroded at about five and a half feet(1.6m.) every year.The reason for this fast process of erosion is the strong winter gales and high tides,which continually wash away the soft Boulder Clay.The beach at Tunstall does not afford any protection either,in fact it adds to the erosion,as the beach is mainly shingle.During the winter storms the sea picks up the large and small stones and hurls them at the clay cliffs so increasing the speed of erosion.
